{{cpp/title|regex_traits}}
{{cpp/regex/regex_traits/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=regex|since=c++11|1=
template&lt; class CharT &gt;
class regex_traits;
}}

The type trait template {{tt|regex_traits}} supplies {{lc|std::basic_regex}} with the set of types and functions necessary to operate on the type {{tt|CharT}}.

Since many of regex operations are locale-sensitive (when {{lc|std::regex_constants::collate}} flag is set), the regex_traits class typically holds an instance of a {{lc|std::locale}} as a private member.

===Standard specializations===
Two specializations of {{tt|std::regex_traits}} are defined by the standard library:
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc|{{tt|std::regex_traits&lt;char&gt;}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|std::regex_traits&lt;wchar_t&gt;}}}}
{{dsc end}}
These specializations make it possible to use {{c|std::basic_regex&lt;char&gt;}} (aka {{lc|std::regex}}) and {{c|std::basic_regex&lt;wchar_t&gt;}} (aka {{lc|std::wregex}}). To use {{lc|std::basic_regex}} with other character types (for example, {{c|char32_t}}), a user-provided trait class must be used.
